jobDescription: Seasoned is a recently launched, extremely well-funded start­up that is focused on disrupting the high growth, high turnover food service industry. Our goal is to continually improve the lives and livelihoods of the service industry professionals we serve with unmatched access to careers, content, and connections. The team is led by an experienced set of consumer technology veterans from LinkedIn, Lynda, Art.com and Home Away who have experience building rich, customer friendly experiences.  We’re a small, scrappy team that’s extremely focused and growing fast. We believe food and drink are one of the world's few universal joys and commit every day to improving the lives and livelihoods of those behind it.  No other company seeks to create a place as diverse and dynamic as the industry we serve. With offices in Austin, TX and San Francisco, CA, we’re looking for people excited about being at the heart of how 10% of the American Workforce thrives. ResponsibilitiesWork closely with Seasoned’s Product Management, Design, Marketing, and Engineering teams to understand their needs, requirements, and goals to drive the Data & Analytics vision, strategy, and roadmapServe as the data and analytics domain expert, evangelizing data literacy and build a suite of tools to empower every Seasoned employee to make data-informed decisionsProvide support and expertise to other Product Managers in defining KPIs and technical data requirements to ensure each new project launches with proper tracking enabling each team to measure the success of their respective productBuild out reports and dashboards for each department to be able to successfully track their KPIsOwn the roadmap and priority of Seasoned’s data infrastructureOwn all things ETL (Extract, Transform and Load), in terms of specifying different integrations and improving them as neededOwn the A/B testing program including analyzing the resultsRequirements3+ years of experience building analytical tools or data product as a Product ManagerExperience working with SQL, Google Analytics, A/B testing, and building data infrastructure on a large-scale consumer or SaaS productAbility to clearly define product and business KPIs in support of company goals and strategic outcomesUnderstanding the technical architecture of data pipelines, warehousing, and tracking systemsStrong communication skills that build and foster cross-team collaboration and alignment on key outcomes and objectivesDeep understanding and empathy for usersWillingness to get your hands dirty conducting data analysis, building dashboards, and supporting internal and external data requests Come Join us in building something smart, unique and useful. This role is a full-time and salaried position that includes health, dental, and vision benefits plus company equity and more.
